Equestrian

York produced an impressive victory in the mixed Equestrian, the first event of Roses 2007. There was an air of dignity to the event on Thursday, as both sides were decked out in their smart matching team gilets and jackets.

Netball Womens 1sts

<strong>Lancaster 37 York 32</strong> Lancaster produced a solid performance to take the points in a high-scoring game on Saturday. After just five minutes Lancaster were already leading, with the Lancaster Goal Attack Francois overpowering the York Goalkeeper.

Lacrosse Womens 1sts

Tennis

<strong>Total: York 10 - Lancaster 4</strong> York defeated Lancaster in both the Mixed and Men's tennis matches but lost heavily in the Women's to complete a day of mixed fortunes.

Live Commentary

<strong>Saturday 9:50am</strong> Good morning to all you early birds. This is <strong>Daniel Whitehead</strong> seeing you through your Weetabix and orange juice this Saturday morning.

First Day Report

<strong>A domineering performance from York University saw them cruise into a 34 point lead over Lancaster after the opening day of Roses 2007.</strong> Going into the day with a six point cushion from Thursday's Equestrian, York never looked like they were under any pressure with impressive performances from the squash, badminton and skiing teams.
